quotes: The rapid rise of Yudhoyono's (center) popularity helped the Democratic Party garner 7.45% of votes during the April 2004 legislative election.
On 5 July 2004, Yudhoyono participated in the first round of the presidential election, coming first with 33% of the votes.

organizations.name: Democratic Party
quotes: The party won 7.5% of the votes, which was still enough to nominate Yudhoyono as a presidential candidate.

Aside from the Democratic Party, their presidential and vice-presidential candidacy was supported by the Crescent Star Party (PBB), the Reform Star Party (PBR) and the Indonesian Justice and Unity Party (PKPI).
The rapid rise of Yudhoyono's (center) popularity helped the Democratic Party garner 7.45% of votes during the April 2004 legislative election.

organizations.name: Golkar
quotes: Yudhoyono accepted the nomination and picked Golkar's Jusuf Kalla as his running mate.

In the run-off, Yudhoyono faced a challenge from Megawati's Indonesian Democratic Party-Struggle (PDI-P), forming a national coalition with Golkar, the PPP, Prosperous Peace Party (PDS) and the Indonesian National Party (PNI).

organizations.name: Indonesian National Party (PNI)
quotes: In the run-off, Yudhoyono faced a challenge from Megawati's Indonesian Democratic Party-Struggle (PDI-P), forming a national coalition with Golkar, the PPP, Prosperous Peace Party (PDS) and the Indonesian National Party (PNI).

organizations.name: National Awakening Party (PKB)
quotes: Yudhoyono then declared that his coalition, which now received political support from the National Awakening Party (PKB), the Prosperous Justice Party (PKS) and the National Mandate Party (PAN), would be the people's coalition.
